faculties_accepted: Department of Civil, Geo and Environmental Engineering
Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
module_restrictions: Some master-level courses conducted in English are not open to NUS students
Business modules from TUM School of Management are excluded from the exchange
NUS Department of Architecture administers its own faculty-level exchange programme with TUM Architecture

visa_info.EU citizens and citizens from the follow: Australia, Canada, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Liechtenstein, Monaco, New Zealand, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland and the United States. However, after entering Germany, you will have to apply for a residence permit at the local "Auslaenderbehörde" (Immigration Office) if you are staying for more than three months.
visa_info.Students from all other countries: must apply for a visa for study purposes via the German diplomatic representation in their home country. You must not under any circumstances travel to Germany on a tourist visa.

accommodations_info.university_accommodation: For more information about accommodation, please refer to https://www.international.tum.de/en/global/accommodation/. Due to the housing shortage in Munich, please take note that student accommodation might not be available.
accommodations_info.private_accommodation: Students can also search for an apartment or a room on the private market, as well as apply for a room in a dormitory run by a social/private organization. Click here for more info: https://www.tum.de/studium/im-studium/wohnen-und-arbeiten/wohnen/privater-wohnungsmarkt

cost_of_living.financial_support_statement_requirement: In order to receive a residence
